instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00928 NO water damage, 20V, No fan, no chime, no image, no boot
threads.message:
Hello 

I have a A1707 with board 820-00928 That not starting at  all, it is not liquid damaged and have no physical problem.

I read some of the posts and didi some checked up some parts. I found out that  PM_BATLOW_L is  0v but could not find out where the problem is.

Appreciate your help

threads.title: 820-00928 NO water damage, 20V, No fan, no chime, no image, no boot
threads.message:
Using a genuine Apple 87W USB-C AC adapter?
What's the voltage and current consumption shown on USB-C ammeter?
All G3H and S5 rails have correct voltage?

threads.title: 820-00928 NO water damage, 20V, No fan, no chime, no image, no boot
threads.message:
Do you get 3V3_S5/SUS?
Post exact voltage for PPBUS_G3H and 3V3_G3H.

threads.title: 820-00928 NO water damage, 20V, No fan, no chime, no image, no boot
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H  12.6 v
PP3V3_G3H   3.4  v
PP3V3_S5      3.3  v
PP3V3_S5_POLARIS  3.3  v
PP3V3_SUS   3.3  v

On the USB-C meter i have: 
19.7 v 
0.02 A
5mah

threads.title: 820-00928 NO water damage, 20V, No fan, no chime, no image, no boot
threads.message:
PM_BATLOW_L must be high, if not PCH doesn't start power on sequence.
Try original 87W charger.

Did you try to start with both charger and battery connected?
Does it charge the battery?

threads.title: 820-00928 NO water damage, 20V, No fan, no chime, no image, no boot
threads.message:
I using an original 87W charger and tried to connect both batteri and charger , but no boot.

 I,m not sure what do you mean by if not PCH doesn't start power on sequence.

where the PM_BATLOW_L start från, i could not really find out what component turn it on.

threads.title: 820-00928 NO water damage, 20V, No fan, no chime, no image, no boot
threads.message:
Post SMC_ONOFF_L, PM_PWRBTN_L and PM_RSMRST_L.
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L at same time.

threads.title: 820-00928 NO water damage, 20V, No fan, no chime, no image, no boot
threads.message:
SMC_ONOFF_L 3.4v
PM_PWRBTN_L 3.3v
PM_RSMRST_L 3.3v

What voltage should i trigger 3.4v?

threads.title: 820-00928 NO water damage, 20V, No fan, no chime, no image, no boot
threads.message: I triggered 5 v but got 0 v on PM_PWRBTN_L

threads.title: 820-00928 NO water damage, 20V, No fan, no chime, no image, no boot
threads.message:
"What voltage should i trigger 3.4v?"
???
"Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L..."

You can use R5226, or SW5200 pads, instead of power button.
Make only temporary contact.
